scenario_text.value: *huff* *huff* *huff*...

What the heck’s going on?!
We’ve been walking for hours...

Um, Professor?
I hate to say it, but are we lost?

I’m afraid you might be right. It’s strange.
I’ve been to this shrine countless times...

Yet I’ve never seen these trees before.
Whatever might this strange flora be...?

Just look at all this fog. Do you think it’s
making us go around in circles?

No way. Even a child could get across this
area in an hour! Don’t tell me...

Are we, like...stuck here somehow?
Like for real?!

Indeed. A normally impossible conjecture, but
we have lost consciousness.

Getting stuck is certainly odd. If it has
occurred, there must be a reason.
A reason? Like what?

This is just a theory, but perhaps we inhaled
some sort of noxious gas?
No way! Now you’re freaking me out...

It would explain a loss of directional sense,
and would certainly explain why we’re stuck.

When I awoke, I was standing alone in a grove
of trees surrounded by red spider lilies...

That’s when I heard you, and rushed over.
Do you all remember anything before we met?

Hmm, my memories are definitely fuzzy...
and there’s this weird fog. What’s going on?

Well. You all came to do some research, yes?
I believe looking for this “reason” counts.

You’re not even part of our study group!
Ohhh I’ve had it, I just wanna go home!

We still have to get back to the camp grounds
first. Home is even farther away than that.

Now ain’t the time for splitting hairs!
Maaan, my legs are stiff as a board already!

And I say now’s no time to start whining!
Those legs are your only way out of here!

Thanks for the lesson, Captain Obvious. It’s
not like I asked you to carry me or anything!

Now, now, this is a waste of energy.
Here, Saki, I’ll carry you if you’d like.
I...I’ll pass, thanks.

That’s right you will. You shouldn’t be
saying things that upset the professor.
For that matter, Professor, you shouldn’t coddle her.

And I suggest you lead by example, instead
of simply chiding her without ears to listen.

At any rate, it’s only the three of us here.
We have no one to rely on but each other.
Yeah, I guess that’s true...

Hey... Where did Aoi and the others go?!
That Miu kid was with us, too—
Wait, did you hear that?

There shouldn’t be any bears in this region.
It could’ve been a monkey...or maybe a boar?
At any rate, best to remain vigilant.
Over here, Lopmon!
Ah, yeah, okay!
What the—?!
Is...is that an animal?!
What in the world?!
You guys are...
Huh...?

Uh, Professor!
Have you ever heard of a creature like this?!
You’re...?
Wh-what is it...?
I...I can’t believe my eyes...

Wait. Don’t tell me. This isn’t one of those
legendary “Kemonogami” things, is it?!

A Kemonogami?! That’s impossible!
Those things can’t really exist!

This thing looking right at us says
different! Right, Professor?
Unbelievable... They really...
Uhh... I think we broke him...

Can you blame him? I mean I’m shocked myself,
but he’s been researching them for years...
Ummm, like, hello? Mr. Kemonogami?
Hey! Don’t approach it so carelessly!

I just thought it might understand words,
that’s all...
Yeeep!
Whoa! What the—?!
Uwaaah!

Oh no... 
I think they might be dangerous!

Eek, it’s coming over here!
Shoo! Shoo!!!

We’re being chased by them!
They’re freaking scary!!!
YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEP!!!

Oh, oh no!
Look out, Saki!
GAAAUGH!

Yikes!
Professor?!
Oh no... Professor!
He... He protected me!

Eek!
Now there’s a bunch of them!

We have to save the professor...
The monsters are swarming him!

S-stay away! Don’t worry about me, just
run away!
But—!
We’re in trouble if we stick around here!
Please, Shuuji...go on, now!

Professor...
Dammit!

Hey... Come on, Shuuji.
We’ve gotta get outta here!
Let’s go, Saki!
Huh?!
Come on, just run!
Professor! No!!!

It’s fine...
It’s up to us adults to protect children.
The rest is in your hands, Shuuji.

Wait, Shuuji!
We can’t just leave him—

We can’t let his sacrifice be in vain!
Let’s get out of here!
